@the_box_head wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:2, topic:360207”]i’ve a question about it too , what does this mean?

For others to see your highscores you must portforward on port 80

how can i portforward on port 80?[/quote]

Go to your browser and type in like 10.10.10.1

or go to server tutorials on here, and look for " how to portforward easy way"

item.title: Help adding Highscores 317
item.dc:creator: @the_box_head the box head
item.description:
@the_box_head wrote:

Ok so i followed deathchaos09’s tutorial witch can be found here

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

I followed it through all going fine etc etc… then i get to the last part …this.
Step 2:
Than open SQL.java and search for this

   [code] public static void createConnection() {
            try {
                    Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance();
                    con = DriverManager.getConnection(
                                    "jdbc:mysql://localhost/highscore", "USERNAME", "PASSWORD");
                    stmt = con.createStatement();
                    connectionMade = true;
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    connectionMade = false;
                    e.printStackTrace();
            }
    }[/code]

So i go into my sql.java… look for this and this is what mine says

public static void createConnection() { try { Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance(); con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://localhost/highscores","root","patrisha"); stmt = con.createStatement(); } catch (Exception e) { //e.printStackTrace(); }

Nothing like his… any help would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
